Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2019 10:17PM cassiecanada wrote: Hi Alice- thx for responding. i hear the same thing- that starting rads in the window of up to 12 weeks is ok. however, i cant help but winder if i had just gone ahead with full rad i’d have started by now. So now as the clock ticks, i wonder if i made the right choice-more time for rogue cells to activate etc.... or if i just need to calm down and believe the people who are obviously the expert
Posts.Title: can radiation begin at 11 weeks. waiting for genetic results cassiecanada AliceBastable

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2019 10:08PM cassiecanada wrote: hi Muska- At mtg with radiologist it seemed that partial rad was perfect fir my situation but the prob was my family history...if i carry the gene, i would need full rad. so either wait on gene testing snd push the rads firther out. or launch in with full breast rad now. I chose to do the test but now the wait is killing me and i envision rogue cells exploring and dividing etc as i wait
Posts.Title: can radiation begin at 11 weeks. waiting for genetic results cassiecanada AliceBastable

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2019 08:43AM cassiecanada wrote: Hi Melza No doc , nor myself , could feel my lump dx Jan/2019. I never did self exam and postponed mamogram over and over. The non stop oc-ing over my perceived self neglect drove me crazy. Looking back, the fact it was caught eventually...and dealt with...is the only way forward. You did the right thing by being proactive and although the lump may not even be cancer, it sounds like you are on right path! Put the guilt to rest! I know its hard- but the reality is- many of these lumps are just not palpable- in fact , my radiologist told me self exams are actually discouraged now. Still hard to believe that, tho. I am sure you are in good hands now- take each day as it comes and try not to let your head do the “ what if” game. Theres no winning that one! ps.. Alice- you crack me up- reading these posts can be scary and worrisome, but your spunky wit brings much needed levity and smiles to these forum
